channel.title: Port forwarding help asap?
channel.description: i just tried to port forward my linksys wrt54g router on portforward.com and it said i need a static ip address so i read the guide on how to get one and i did everything it said i changed all the settings. it disconnected me from the internet so i changed them back and it came back on. so does that mean i cant port forward? or can someone get on team viewer and help me? if this helps, the thing i use to connect to the internet is a mobile company broadband usb adapter. its like a flash drive that plugs into the usb. and its my modem and gives me the internet. if thats not understanding, go to this link to see it. http://www.mycricket.com/assets/community/4090213014a3baf99e554b.jpg

item.title: Port forwarding help asap?
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Despair Mr. Despair
item.description:
@Mr_Despair wrote:

Before you do the whole CMD, do the obtain IP automatically. Then when you find out that info enter it again.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding help asap?
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

[quote author=Mr. Despair link=topic=42]
it always says ipconfig is not recognized as an internal or external command, windows batch file or operable program.
thats why i have to run it as admin.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding help asap?
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Despair Mr. Despair
item.description:
@Mr_Despair wrote:

Hold shift+right click on your desktop> Open command window here> then type in ipconfig when prompted. Your info about your computer will come up, the IP address you’ll enter in the Network Connections is the IPV4 and the other information is listed in the CMD box, if I missed your question correct me.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding help asap?
item.dc:creator: @kicker862 kicker862
item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

Mr. Despair:

A static ip you say, hmm, that shouldn’t decide whether you can or can’t port forward. You’re getting disconnected because you’re doing it wrong, what are the steps your doing to set a static IP?

ok.
first, i run my command prompt as admin.
i type ipconfig /all
i get the ipv4, subnet mask, and default gateway for my internet modem.
and then i get the ip4v and subnet mask for my router.
then i go to network and sharing center and click manage networks
then i click on properties for my internet connection.
and mine was set on automatically obtain ip address and dns.
so i changed it to set it, and i set it to my routers ip, but then this is what it said my dns is: fec0:0:0:ffff::1%2
fec0:0:0:ffff::2%2 and fec0:0:0:ffff::3%2

but i figured theres something wrong with that?
so i just put my internet’s dns.
and then closed it out and then on the port forward site it said 192.168.1 and then a text box for me to put the rest.
even though mine said its 192.168.0.1
and then when i try to log onto my router from an internet browser it just says the page is unavailable. and then i went on google but it said i was disconnected from the internet.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding help asap?
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Despair Mr. Despair
item.description:
@Mr_Despair wrote:

A static ip you say, hmm, that shouldn’t decide whether you can or can’t port forward. You’re getting disconnected because you’re doing it wrong, what are the steps your doing to set a static IP?

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding help asap?

item.description:
@kicker862 wrote:

i just tried to port forward my linksys wrt54g router on portforward.com and it said i need a static ip address so i read the guide on how to get one and i did everything it said i changed all the settings.
it disconnected me from the internet so i changed them back and it came back on.
so does that mean i cant port forward?
or can someone get on team viewer and help me?
if this helps, the thing i use to connect to the internet is a mobile company broadband usb adapter.
its like a flash drive that plugs into the usb. and its my modem and gives me the internet.
if thats not understanding, go to this link to see it.
http://www.mycricket.com/assets/community/4090213014a3baf99e554b.jpg
